item.title: Hacker Conversations: Rachel Tobac and the Art of Social Engineering
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
Rachel Tobac is a cyber social engineer. She is skilled at persuading people to do what she wants, rather than what they know they ought to do.

The post Hacker Conversations: Rachel Tobac and the Art of Social Engineering appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Casie Antalis Named Executive Director of CISA
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Casie Antalis is the new executive director of the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency after the departure of Bridget Bean.

The post Casie Antalis Named Executive Director of CISA appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Airoha Chip Vulnerabilities Expose Headphones to Takeover
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Vulnerabilities in Airoha Bluetooth SoCs expose headphone and earbud products from multiple vendors to takeover attacks.

The post Airoha Chip Vulnerabilities Expose Headphones to Takeover appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Canada Gives Hikvision the Boot on National Security Grounds
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Canada has ordered Hikvision to cease all operations in the country and prohibited the purchase and use of Hikvision products within government entities.

The post Canada Gives Hikvision the Boot on National Security Grounds appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Patrick Ware Named Executive Director of US Cyber Command
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
The NSA’s Patrick Ware has taken up the role of Cybercrom executive director after the departure of Morgan Adamski.

The post Patrick Ware Named Executive Director of US Cyber Command appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Hawaiian Airlines Hacked as Aviation Sector Warned of Scattered Spider Attacks
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Scattered Spider is targeting airlines and the recent WestJet hack is believed to be the work of the notorious cybercrime group.

The post Hawaiian Airlines Hacked as Aviation Sector Warned of Scattered Spider Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Ahold Delhaize Data Breach Impacts 2.2 Million People
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
The ransomware attack against grocery giant Ahold Delhaize has resulted in the personal information of millions getting stolen.

The post Ahold Delhaize Data Breach Impacts 2.2 Million People appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Windows’ Infamous ‘Blue Screen of Death’ Will Soon Turn Black
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
After more than 40 years of being set against a very recognizable blue, the updated error message will soon be displayed across a black background.

The post Windows’ Infamous ‘Blue Screen of Death’ Will Soon Turn Black appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: In Other News: Norway Dam Hacked, $177M Data Breach Settlement, UNFI Attack Update
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Noteworthy stories that might have slipped under the radar: Norwegian dam hacked, AT&T agrees to $177 million data breach settlement, Whole Foods distributor restores systems after attack. 

The post In Other News: Norway Dam Hacked, $177M Data Breach Settlement, UNFI Attack Update appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Microsoft to Preview New Windows Endpoint Security Platform After CrowdStrike Outage
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Microsoft is preparing a private preview of new Windows endpoint security platform capabilities to help antimalware vendors create solutions that run outside the kernel.

The post Microsoft to Preview New Windows Endpoint Security Platform After CrowdStrike Outage  appeared first on SecurityWeek.
